greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(-q) * phi(-q^4) in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of f(-q, -q) * f(q, -q) in powers of q where f(,) is the Ramanujan general theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 21 2015
Expansion of eta(q)^2 * eta(q^4)^2 / (eta(q^2) * eta(q^8)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (64 t)) = 64 (t/i) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A053692.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^4], {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A)^2 / (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^8 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 08 2014
